text:
I’m not sure the order of operations here, and I could have just been late to the party, but I’ve been thinking since early 2015 that Trend #5 Machine learning, not software, will eat the world.

And so yesterday at 11:30am in the morning, I realized there wasn’t a great way for a random software developer to get onboarded into this new world easily, other than Andrew Ng’s now classic ML course that’s been around for years. Thusly, I forth-tweeted:

Then, and OMG, get this, as I was going to bed, I was reading my “bloggies” and came across some lovely news. Udacity had just partnered with Google to launch their own DL class. And no, that doesn’t stand for down-low you crazy kids. It stands for Learning on a WHOLE NEW PLANE.

I guess when you tell the universe what you want, it conspires to give it to you:

And so, because of this noreaster winter wonderland that we’re about to have in NYC this weekend, maybe you spend some time with a bottle of red, red wine and some scientist dudes to learn how all software will be developed in the future (MVC, eat your heart out).
title: The Learning That Is Deep –
